ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Knowledge: molecular microbiology, plant microbiology, medical microbiology
Skills: bacterial plating, screening and selection, various assays, light microscopy, staining, DNA isolation, how to write a lab report
How to perform lab techniques related to microbiology
Basic microbiology lab techniques with a survey of many microorganisms

DNA isolation and extraction.
Methods for identifying different microbes, for example how to use a light microscope and staining methods.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: learned a lot, Prof. Carland and Celena were both super willing to help and answer questions during lab, did some fun experiments, field trip to Marsh Botanical Gardens was fun.
Weaknesses: there could have been more guidance for the first lab report
Good lab class. It would be helpful if there was a sample lab report given since the instructions were still some what unclear of how to write the lab report  for full points.
Lab reports could be broken down to be more digestible, but overall instruction was great!

This semester was perfect!
Dr. Carland made some changes to the original syllabus which made each experiment less stressful and learning a lot more fun! Because, this enabled us to really take our time and deep dive into each experiment.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Loved the size of the class that made in person doable
Everything except for the two meetings we had were in person which was great!

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, great way to fulfill your pre-med bio lab requirement while learning a lot and having fun.
Yes, this lab class is very chill and not too high of a workload.
Not sure. Since Dr. Carland won't be teaching this course again I don't think I will be able to fairly state whether this course is/will be as good as I experienced it.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We had one virtual lab at the beginning of the year, and one virtual career discussion day.
